website_summaries.verdict: One of the best penlights on the market with a price to match.
pros: Incredibly bright light with a well-focused beam
Durable casing can take drops, falls, and tough weather
Recharge the battery with a USB cable
Doesn't get warm with prolonged use
cons: Can be hard to turn on and off, but that also means it won't accidentally turn on while in your pocket or purse

customer_reviews.title: I lost this flashlight two years ago and just found ...
customer_reviews.text: I lost this flashlight two years ago and just found it the other day buried under mud and leaves...... Still works!!!
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: The switch is  indeed terrible and useless.
customer_reviews.text: I don't ask alot from a small flashlight... Does have to work at least when I first get it.. this one did not.. I noticed alot of reviews about the cheap switch... it is... I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: KenB

customer_reviews.title: Design Flaw - You Don't Want this Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Please read the other reviews that talk about the tail cap issue. Flashlight is unreliable unless you're willing to shim/modify the end cap to make it work reliably. Not something you should have to do on a brand name product. Mine also had basic issue with connectivity to the tail cap where it wouldn't work at all. Didn't try it out until past the return window so now I'm stuck with it and will either have to fix it myself or start a warranty claim.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyB_M

customer_reviews.title: Returning it...will post update if replacement works fine
customer_reviews.text: Product was defective out of the box. Due to its packaging, you must pretty much destroy the box in order to get the flashlight out which I hope is not an issue with Amazon. The issue is common to some other reviewers: the flashlight will simply not function with batteries and fully assembled. The light does come on/flicker while I'm screwing on the cap but once it's on there the flashlight is completely dead. This to me says lack of workmanship and QA. I am attempting to have it replaced via Amazon and will update this if the replacement is working as advertised. Update: the replacement was DOA as well. Horrible product. Avoid at all costs.
customer_reviews.author: Nicko Demeter

customer_reviews.title: Wish it Came in a AA Model...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent quality, bright, simple to operate light. I don't want a "fiddly" light with many functions and a strobe all on one confusing switch that I have to toggle through every time I turn it on; I just want simple on/off and this is it for me. No issues with the switch operation on mine. Plenty bright enough to see everything you need to at close range, yet small enough to maneuver into tight spaces and light enough to carry in a shirt pocket. Great light! I just wish they had a simple version like this in an AA model so I could get longer run time between battery changes.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Junk after two months
customer_reviews.text: I love this Flashlight because it is small enough to hold with your mouth while using both hands. The problem lies in the On/Off Switch. I purchased it on June 7th 2019. Now, on August 3rd, it's in the Garbage. Just like the exact one I purchased in January, the switch went bad. In fairness I do carry it in my pocket every day. But Two months?.. For this price?... Not one, but Two of the EXACT same flashlight?? ... Never again?.. Look for another light to purchase as I did.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I did some research on durable flashlights, and this model was one of the top listed. Imagine my surprise when two of these came to my house, and one would not work at all. Tried different batteries and still no go on one. The 2nd light apparently came with dead batteries, as the new ones I installed would allow me to power on the light. But the button to get the light to come on almost required two hands to make work. And I'm not a small guy, 6'1" and 200+ lbs, so I have plenty of hand strength. They are both going back with no chance of ordering them again.
customer_reviews.author: Hilton

customer_reviews.title: Two Defective Blue Flashlights
customer_reviews.text: First blue flashlight arrived defective. Amazon sent an identical replacement. The second flashlight also arrived defective. So I'm 0 for 2 on blue flashlights. Side note: I previously had this same flashlight in black. It worked great until I lost it. I guess I'll chalk up my blue flashlight failure to either statistical anomaly or a bad production run.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W. S.

customer_reviews.title: Bad switch
customer_reviews.text: The switch is quite stiff, but it worked OK for a couple of weeks, then the switch developed a loose connection, and now it is either not working or when it is on it strobes. I asked the company for a refund, and all they would do is send me another bad switch, that wouldn't work right off. Don't waste your money on this flashlight! Buy EverBrite 4-pack LED Penlight instead. These work great!
customer_reviews.author: Midway Marketing

customer_reviews.title: Dead right out of the package.
customer_reviews.text: I tried multiple batteries to ensure the ones that came with it weren't dead. I also ensured they were installed correctly too. Nothing. Called Streamlight tech support and they said possible faulty tailcap switch. They said return it to where I bought it or pay to have it sent in and fixed. I opted to send it back to Amazon. I'll probably buy another one once they refund my account. Hopefully the second go round will be a winner.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Quality light with more than enough output.
customer_reviews.text: streamlight quality!! Cant describe it.. other than once you hold the light you know it quality. Everything feels solid. I have a microstream as well... love it. The runtime is amazing!! People brag about the lumens all the time but what is the sense in having a 180 lumens if it only last 20min...cough..olighti3T..cough. I love simplicity of having having AAA batteries. 100 lumens are more than enough to find a path, look under the coach, work or disorienting someone. I highly recommend The Stylus Pro (just make sure you get the 100 lumen version and not the older version with around 60). The only thing that is missing is a low and medium mode ... pls Streamlight!!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. P

customer_reviews.title: Utility of caring this is excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Being weird I have this device and a small tape measure in my pocket (along with multitool on my belt) and construction is good overall. Others have complained about the permanent on/momentary switch not working all the time or at all. I had the same issue, however, I found if I pushed on the edge of the switch to stay on instead of pushing the center for momentary. The light is more than sufficient to do what I want and for my old eyes not that much difference compared to a Scorpion X (streamlight).
customer_reviews.author: Maicokid

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: Was really disappointed on this one. It's got such a nice size and heft. But when I put the batteries in and screwed it closed, it wouldn't work. I fiddled with it for a while and found that I could actually briefly get it to turn on when the battery lid was mostly unscrewed, just barely creating the necessary connection to the batteries (so I know the batteries weren't the problem). But all the way closed, no luck at all. Good thing I had cheapo backup flashlights for Christmas presents! (No, this wouldn't have spoiled Christmas anyway, but it was very unfortunate.)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Honestly.. dissappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I'm a big fan of streamlight products, infact my EDC light is a streamlight stylus pro. I had really high hopes for this one, but it just does not deliver. I am a diesel mechanic by trade, so I have dozens of flashlights of all shapes and sizes from snap-on to harbor freight and everything inbetween and for the money I would not recommend this COB light at all. Everything about this light is pretty good as far as construction and durability...EXECPT for the brightness. Which, let's be honest is the most important aspect in a flashlight. It just doesn't throw enough light to be useful.
customer_reviews.author: S. Loglisci

customer_reviews.title: Love this light. Battery life could be better, but I'll blame the battery, and not the light.
customer_reviews.text: I love my streamlight penlights.. in the mechanic world, they are like gold. These exact same penlights sell, all day long for $40 on the snap-on, Matco, and MAC trucks... I almost thought about making just a streamlight truck to drive around and sell to all the auto shops for $30... but unfortunately it takes money to make money.... and I'm a poor person. So I'll stick to buying $17.00 penlights while all the big balling mechanics pay $40.00 for the exact same light.
customer_reviews.author: George McFall

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Warranty Support
customer_reviews.text: Great flashlight. Mine failed between 1-2 years. I suspect it was a failure of the LED since I tried shorting across the tail switch and swapping out with another from other flashlight. I filled out warranty request on Streamlight's webpage, printed out label, and mailed it back. Had to pay for return shipping but could ship cheaply with USPS. Streamight mailed out a new flashlight immediately after receiving mine. This is excellent warranty support! I believe in supporting companies that take great care of their customers and will be purchasing more items from Streamlight in the future.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: Nice light when you need it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a small bright light that comes in very handy. Easy to fit in your pocket! Robust and of quality construction. And did I mention that's it's very bright? It's very helpful when working on machinery and automobiles. Small and compact enough to get in those tight spots and give you the light when needed. Long battery life for normal use. Pocket clip for your shirt pocket. I've never had any issues with this light!
customer_reviews.author: Kdawg74Top Contributor: Archery

customer_reviews.title: This little flash light is amazing!
customer_reviews.text: It's an aluminum body which has a good feel to it, the coating texture is nice. The button press is solid which Inlove! my 3-year-old can't turn it on but he is weak and that's ok with me. Best things about this flashlight: Slim smooth Case Positive push button in the back Only on/off - not flashing or high/lo AAA batteries and it works great on EBL rechargeables. Cons: Little awkward to screw the back cap on because of the belt spring being really tight, be careful or you can easily strip the threads.
customer_reviews.author: Darren

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this light, small yet powerful.
customer_reviews.text: I’m so impressed with this little light in size, with it’s lighthouse beam! Many have voiced concern with how hard it is to push the button on. It’s like that for good reason! I have had many lights in the passed that failed me, when it was turned on somehow while be carried or packed in my go bag. that won’t happen with this baby. Powerful light that can temporarily blind you, strongly built, easy to pack and ready when needed. Everyone I have showed this to or have seen me use it is impressed, Shhhhh, they could charge more and it would be worth it!
customer_reviews.author: John H. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Durable Compact Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: As an HVAC journeyman, I use this streamlight almost every single work day. It’s recently becoming a permanent fixture to my everyday carry (EDC) items. It fits perfect in the vinyl sheath for my Leatherman Surge. It’s compact and definitely packs a punch for the size. I forgot to take the flashlight out of my shirt pocket which resulted in the flashlight going through both my washer and my dryer. It still works great and the only thing it did was clean it off! I couldn’t be happier with my purchase and plan on purchasing the 360 degree version and maybe the inspection model also. This review was posted after 6 months of use of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Jimi

customer_reviews.title: Light when you need it
customer_reviews.text: To be clear the first one I ordered did not work so I ordered a replacement. The replacement arrived before I had wrapped and shipped the original back. Great customer service! I love this light. It’s great for work or walking in the house at night without turning on the lights. I also use it when I walk the dogs at night. I can see my path and drivers can see us. Highly recommended! It is a little wider than a writing pen and fits in my pocket perfectly. Nice and bright too!
customer_reviews.author: Big-L-HOU

customer_reviews.title: FREAKING AWSOME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt have night vision so put a 1 star for that lol battery life I like it's about 8 to 10 hours from my experience. And the brightness is exactly what I wanted. For what I'm doing it's perfect. Dont need a 500 or 1000 lumens from 2 or 3 feet away to burn my eye balls off. Hahah the lumens on this is great for working on cars, working in tight areas and going out in the dark to see 20 to 30 feet in front of me. This is my 3rd one only because I keep loosing them because they are so small. But would 100% recommend it. Along with ANY OTHER STREAMLIGHT PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Flashlight lasted 6 days
customer_reviews.text: Having owned multiple Streamlight products in the past, I ordered this flashlight for a family member as a Christmas gift. I gave him the light on Christmas eve, It was used 3 times and no longer lights up. Amazon replaced it... Let's see how this one works out.
customer_reviews.author: Lafamilia

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy, has definate manufacturer defect that is not being properly addressed.
customer_reviews.text: I'm shocked that streamlight would continue to manufacture a clearly defective light with the notorious tail switch malfunction... I thought surely the reviews I read were a one off here and there. Well... Here I am, about 6 months into owning this light and the tail switch is malfunctioning... I have other streamlight products that have performed well. I surely won't be purchasing any more products from them. I have a cheap harbor freight light this was replacing for my work. I had to drag the 1/4 price harbor freight light back out to use to finish my shift. Disappointing to an extreme...
customer_reviews.author: Sam Young

customer_reviews.title: Not a one-handed light
customer_reviews.text: For the most part, this is a well made, simple, functional inspection light. However, it has one serious drawback which keeps it from being a practical EDC light. The tail switch has a heavy rubber cover which is very hard to depress, especially with your thumb. In addition, you have to push it way in to activate the switch. Anyone with weak fingers will have trouble with this light. You can rotate the tail cap to turn it on and off, but it's a bit cumbersome one handed. In summary, if you are looking for an easy to operate light that is available at a moment's notice, this is not that light.
customer_reviews.author: dsum

customer_reviews.title: Good light, but ...
customer_reviews.text: great product with one FLAW. Like many other purchasers, mine has a ridiculously hard switch for keeping the light on. a medium press will activate the light but it won't stay on when you let go. No problem. However if you want permanently on you have to really press hard to get it to click. To the point of jamming your thumb nail in there. This would be a 1 star, but if you are handy you can put a piece of plastic in the switch mechanism to build it up and improve the switch feel. Too thick a piece, (like a credit card was too thick,) and it will make the light stay on with too slight pressure.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo R.

customer_reviews.title: Everything I want in a pocket flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I've been carrying one of these every day for 9 months now. It has everything I want in a compact flashlight: - Durable. Many pocket lights simply don't last, they'll stop working after a month or two of everyday carry. - Firm switch. Almost impossible to turn on by accident, which runs the batteries down while it's in your pocket. Switch actually has two modes, "on" and "momentary". Both are useful. - Nice, focused beam. - Compact and light. - Reasonably priced, you could certainly pay more for less...... I've had a great variety of pocket flashlights over the years, this one is the overall best, by far.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Fannin

customer_reviews.title: Small and very bright
customer_reviews.text: Thin enough for a shirt pocket but still very bright. On/off switch has two modes or positions the first is on only when the button in the base is depressed and held down. Remove the cap/blocking ring and a small button shaped like a ball point pen clicker is exposed. The can be depressed far enough to turn the light on without holding it down. I have never had quality or durability problems with Streamlight. Should there be a problem, I will update the review.
customer_reviews.author: Charles van Buren

customer_reviews.title: Love this light
customer_reviews.text: Was given this light through the company I work for and really enjoyed it, wasn't till someone stole it that I realized how much I loved it. Tried buying a few other brands but nothing holds a light (pun intended) to this pen light, thus me buying a new one. Yes you are paying a bit more for it but trust me when I say its amazing. No bells or whistle just an led light that takes AA batteries has a shirt clip and button on the end, but what it lacks in the bells and whistles department it makes up for in durability and brightness.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: not as nice as i thought
customer_reviews.text: not as nice as i thought! but seems solid and built well! tail switch too hard to push in! i found that if you remove (unscrew) the rubber button over the switch it works a lot easier and smoother! but you loose your water resistance with cap off! light quality is decent! i also have a pelican 1920 pen light and i like it a lot better then the stream light! smoother and brighter! I collect flashlights from all different brand names and compare them! so bottom line in my opinion, the streamlight is decent ,but there are better ones out there in that class of light!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: This flashlight is so bright and compact! It takes AAA batteries which is nice because they are cheap and we always have some extras in a drawer. It fits easily in your pocket so it can be carried all the time. It does take a little more force than you'd think on the button to get the light to stay on. It was designed to be more of a "press for a quick light and then let go" for momentary opteration. But that's not to say it's hard to turn it on and have it stay on, because it's not.
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Flashlight
customer_reviews.text: These flashlights are great! I've since purchased three of them now to give as gifts after using one at work and loving it. They are very bright and nice and light weight. I also found out they are at least water resistant when I've dropped my light in liquid multiple times. My biggest complaint would be the battery life. They seem to go through batteries rather quick if you use it daily. I use mine to work on cars at work and I still probably get a month or two out of the batteries. The light just seems to get dimmer quickly with the batteries dying. Overall I love this flashlight and highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Strong, small, lightweight and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This is a strong, small, lightweight, and powerful flashlight. I carry it with me when I am working as an EMT, and I love it. It's easy to use, fits nicely in a basic belt pouch, and is strong enough for any place I have to travel. It should be noted that this is NOT an acceptable pen light to be shined into a patient's eye. This should be used for lighting a dark environment. The Pen Light is so lightweight that I never feel it gets in the way either. It allows me almost full use of my hands, even while holding it. I have nothing but high praise for this flashlight and would gladly recommend it to others.
customer_reviews.author: WolfHowl

customer_reviews.title: pattern is "sticky". Hard to remove and replace in pants pocket
customer_reviews.text: It's a sticky finish pattern. It's hard to get into your pocket and also to pull it out. The black ones, which I've owned more than 5, slide in and out without a problem. This camouflage finish doesn't appear to be painted on. it's a strange, sticky finish that slows down deployment.
customer_reviews.author: NomiS

customer_reviews.title: Great light that lasts the wash cycle!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light to keep at my desk at work, but it has turned into more of a daily cart flashlight. It is small enough that you don’t even realize you have it on you, but bright enough to let you see what you need to see. It is also a very durable light. I had lost it for a little while, and finally found it tumbling around in the dryer. I pulled it out, and it lit right up! I plan on buying more, and highly recommend these lights to others!
customer_reviews.author: Cymru129

customer_reviews.title: Not enough stars available!
customer_reviews.text: 6 or 7 stars, if possible! We have 7, in 2 cars and color coded for home areas. These are serviceable bright (very) and work fine with NiMh batteries. Very sturdy build, light enough for mouth-hold. Good runtime. I've asked before about mounting clips ... there don't seem to be any. I posted a response under another one of these, so I'll offer my solution here. I put o-rings (slightly snuggle than the barrel) under the clips. These hang neatly on stick-up hooks, and flip over onto the barrel and out of the way. I've suggested this to the manufacturer. Glowing o-rings are even better.
customer_reviews.author: MeteorMagnet

customer_reviews.title: Unlike my old lite
customer_reviews.text: I'm disappointed in the brightness of this light. I had one identical that was pretty old, loved it, and used it several times a week. It was a LOT brighter and don't know what happened but it finally went out so I bought this. The brightness of the new light is pathetic and doesn't compare. I have no idea of the old one's lumen rating so all I say is the two are identical in every other way. I've tried two sets of new batteries from different packs with no change in brightness. NOT likin' this one.
customer_reviews.author: John M. Strauser

customer_reviews.title: Solid, reliable & bright
customer_reviews.text: This is a great light and now a part of my EDC. I tried buying a cheaper light and was just disappointed. Streamlight makes great lights and I won’t be buying any other brand again. This is pocket friendly, bright, and always reliable. I use it at work for finding things or making my way across a dark room. I wouldn’t recommend this particular model for anything you would need long battery life for. It works perfect for me, but wouldn’t be great for hours on end. I knew this going into the purchase, so 5 stars it is! ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
customer_reviews.author: tshai

customer_reviews.title: simple yet so useful, I'll never be caught without it
customer_reviews.text: I'm an automotive technician, I use this light almost the entire day. From doing inspections to just needing a little light under a dashboard of a car, it's my go to light, I keep it on me 24/7. I will be purchasing an extra to keep at home as well. Stream light has done it again, simple yet so useful, I'll never be caught without it!
customer_reviews.author: Kevmart13

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal
customer_reviews.text: For the price and the product, hard to beat. I gave a 5 star even though I’ve had issues with the clips. I used this unit for a few years but the clip kept getting bent or broke. I finally bought the one with a heavier duty clip and that’s what I carry now. I used this for my edc so I didn’t have to buy a ton of lights for my pistols. Also a firefighter and this is very convenient on every shift I run. Love the product just needs a little better clip.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany B.

customer_reviews.title: The best pen light!
customer_reviews.text: These are the absolute best pen lights. This is my third one because I lost my last two... I dropped one outside, it snowed on it, then it was shoveled into the yard and left there apparently all winter long. Repeatedly snowed and trained on. I found it later that spring, clicked it on and it worked. It's plenty bright, fits in your pocket with the clip and you don't notice it. Virtually indestructible and bright enough for most tasks.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Finn

customer_reviews.title: Super thin, light, and bright!
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a bright flashlight that could fit in my pocket to have at the ready, should a bug inspection request come up on a whim for the type of work I do and this product delivers. Surprisingly the two light mode function is very useful as I wouldn't have thought I would have liked the "quick" option that comes in handy for spot checking. The battery lasted me about 4 months, but should be noted the flashlight was used sparingly so results may vary with consistent use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Rod

customer_reviews.title: Super reliable!
customer_reviews.text: I have a bunch of different flashlights. I work night shift in a manufacturing plant. I USE my flashlights 10+ times a day (minimum). I have tried other brands, some expensive and some not so much and I end up going back to this simple inexpensive slim easy to carry 2 AAA flashlight (and it's little 1AAA counterpart) for one reason. They always work!!! I have had several lights from Thrunite and they failed after 2-6 months (usually the switch and they cost 5 times as much).
customer_reviews.author: snarfzilla

customer_reviews.title: Great 6.5hr runtime on 2 AAA & reliable.
customer_reviews.text: I have a two Streamlight flashlights, one is 750L & the other is 1,100L...didn't think 90 lumens would be as bright as it is ! Plus, 6.5 hour run-time on two AAA batteries & IPX4 water resistance. Yes, the button is a little hard to press, but that's good because you don't want it accidentally being activated in your pocket or purse. The only change I would like is with the pocket clip....it should be attached to the case like the bigger Streamlight flashlights instead of on the cap which sorta makes it difficult to screw it back onto the case without scratching the case( nothing major ). You remove that clip if you'd like :)
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: GREAT little flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flashlight as a gift for a flight attendant who's required to carry a small flashlight at work. This one is perfect and meets the standards of her employer. It's lightweight, has a bright light and is easy to slip in to the pocket of her uniform. The 2nd flashlight was a gift to a college student who also loves it. It's small but gives off an incredible amount of light and is perfect in the glove compartment of a vehicle, around the house and has dozens of different uses.
customer_reviews.author: GoCougs

customer_reviews.title: I carry it every day
customer_reviews.text: There seems to be a quality control issue or multiple versions of this product judging by the negative reviews, but from my experience this light has become essential to my kit. It is extremely lightweight and low-profile while being very bright. I have been using mine for about 2 years for about an hour every couple of days and I haven't been let down. Understand you're not getting a $200 tactical light and you won't be disappointed. One thing I love is that, even in a dress shirt pocket it doesn't look out of place next to pens and stuff; I never use the belt holder.
customer_reviews.author: A. Raccoon

customer_reviews.title: Useful Product
customer_reviews.text: I have used the light several times since getting it and find it to be exactly what I needed. I have noticed only one issue and it is that I have had difficulty getting the light clip to slide completely down into the pocket of my pants. It seems that the light is getting caught up on the opening of the pocket between the clip and body. This issue might be resolved with a slightly more flexible clip or a more flush body underneath the clip.
customer_reviews.author: Spillane Sr

customer_reviews.title: Favorite flashlight
customer_reviews.text: I have several of these flashlights and love them. I bought several this year to give as gifts to friends. They are very bright for the size and work very well. I have not had a problem with any of them that I have owned. I have read of others claiming to have issues with them and something to do with the button but I find all of mine have functioned great for my needs. The size is super small and easy to keep in my front or back pocket. It has become my go to flashlight and I will buy more of them.
customer_reviews.author: BA

customer_reviews.title: Nice little light for your bag or purse
customer_reviews.text: This light has a good amount of light, not so over powering that you cant actually use it day to day like some of the more overpowered Streamlight offerings. Works well for in the car or in a bag or purse to find something you've dropped or illuminate a dark area without totally blinding yourself. Batteries last forever with occasional use and it handles being bounced and dropped regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Grimrivet

customer_reviews.title: Bright, compact and light weight.
customer_reviews.text: Bright, compact and we'll built. Lost my previous one and have missed it dearly. Only complaint I have is this thing will eat the batteries up. 6.5hr run time per set of AAA. I will try lithium batteries to see if that helps. But I'm not surprised with how bright this thing is. I use it for inspecting engines, looking under dashes, mostly mechanical work. Bright white light shows scratches well. I have always been a fan of stream light products. Replacement parts available on manufacturers website. Fits in a pocket nicely, light weight. No real complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Wales

customer_reviews.title: Great little flashlight
customer_reviews.text: Love this flashlight. I never leave home without it! It's bright and a pleasure to use. I've never had any issues with functionality. As far as aesthetics are concerned I love the look but it is prone to scratches and the paint is coming off in places too from use. The included holder that you attach to your belt is a nice addition as well, but it's too bad there isn't a flap for it. Battery live is decent but the maximum brightness won't last very long. It will eventually go to a baseline brightness that spans many hours before the batteries fail. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Sublover1337

customer_reviews.title: I Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: This little flashlight works very well and is constructed to be quite durable. I carry this light on me quite often and have had zero problems with it. My only complaint and trust me it is a minor complaint is that the switch on the rear of the light that activates the beam is very stiff. I'm sure that in time it will lighten up some, I don't want it to become so loose that it accidentally turns on when I have it in my pocket. But I would like it to be a little easier to push then it currently is.
customer_reviews.author: Dave B

customer_reviews.title: This is a flashlight for flashlight lovers.  You need this in your arsenal of personal lighting products!
customer_reviews.text: Totally excellent and bright light. Very solid and extremely useful. Probably can be dragged behind your car on a string for a few miles and it still would work. You cannot go wrong. The only niggling issue is that the button is reasonably easy to press to turn on momentarily but hard to press to make it click and leave the light on. Some, like myself, see that as a feature since we normally don't want to put it down with it on and drain the battery dead.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Ran over by garbage trucks and still works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Great little light. Bought as a direct replacement for one I had lost. After I purchased this one I found my original. It had been outside for three nights in a stone driveway at the landfill, and had been ran over who knows how many times by garbage trucks. I cleaned the mud off and even with a bent lense housing and dented side it still works. I still use the old one every day and kept the replacement for a back up. Solid and well built. Great battery life.
customer_reviews.author: nome de plume

customer_reviews.title: Durability
customer_reviews.text: This light is awesome. I've had mine for 5ish years now and still kicking ass. I drop it almost daily yet still functions every time. The power usage is so low yes so bright that I've killed my batteries but just leaving it off for a few minutes will give about 30 seconds of bright light just on dead battery residual charge. Just testament to its sipping of power while very bright. I've also worn off most of the paint by now but it still works like brand new. Highly recommend. Carry it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron M Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flashlight. I am very pleased with the lights function, size and abilities. I exclusively use Streamlight without exception I firmly believe they are not only the best light available but they also have the most amazing customer service. I have been using their lights at work for 30 years and now that I’m retired I still use the very same Flashlights i used at work throughout the years. This little light is no exception. It is an excellent addition and I am very pleased with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: WD

customer_reviews.title: Best Flashlight yet!
customer_reviews.text: This is my all time favorite flashlight! I have had many different types and sizes of flash lights throughout my life and this is my number one pick. It is as easy to carry as a ink pen, which means i usually have it on me. it is very bright for it's size and weight. Battery life is quite impressive. Sure there are much brighter light out there. But they are in out in your truck or your tool box or back at the shop and not with you. This light will be in your shirt pocket when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: Clyde J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: An awesome little light! Extremely bright and solid beam. Fits very nicely in my shirt pocket ready for when I need it. As far as the "issues" that some people have mentioned regarding the switch, I have seen no issues with it. It is meant to be a momentary only switch unless you push it in more. As far as I am concerned this little flashlight is perfectly handy, very strong, has a solid quality feel and weight, and is one very bright little flashlight. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Gator1969

customer_reviews.title: A flash light you won't let any barrow
customer_reviews.text: I have been using the Streamlight Stylus Pro LED PenLight as a Maintenance Man at Simpson College for years. And I am talking about the one I lost after getting called out to a College Dorm at 2:30 in the morning. I looked for my old Stylus Pro LED PenLight for hours. I had had it for years. Well I didn't find it so I went on line and got a new one from these guys. Thanks now I can see again. Even in the middle of the night.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Dooley

customer_reviews.title: Great Flashlight; Carry it Everyday.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great every day carry flashlight. It fits neatly in my inside suit pocket and otherwise in a jacket or shirt packet. It's very bright for its size. I've had it since December (about 4 months) and have not had to change batteries yet, even though it is used everyday for something (usually finding something I lost in the car or getting into a darkened house).
customer_reviews.author: Chehalin

customer_reviews.title: Great light!
customer_reviews.text: These little flashlights are fantastic and a great value. I bought one and liked it so much that I went and bought two more to keep in my car and around the house. I use one as part of my EDC and the light is so slim that you don't even notice that you have it with you. I have other lights that are in the 300L - 800L range and they are great lights too, but getting 90L out of this compact light is awesome and will take care of your needs. Another great feature is that it takes the very common, and easy to find, AAA batteries. Get one for yourself!
customer_reviews.author: Robbie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my work and EDC
customer_reviews.text: I am a professional technician Works as a pretty good EDC flashlight and as well as inspection light I use it all the time and I take it everywhere it's small but not too small I've use lights during power outages had no trouble scene my surroundings I like to carry it in my pocket is not big and bulky it's comfortable it's just the perfect size I brought this light in coolant on the ground and it still works like the day it came out of its box so you can take a beating
customer_reviews.author: Elvin Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Stiff button..... good light
customer_reviews.text: I like the light, but really only one complaint that I'll attempt to address with a mod or something. The button requires a little too much pressure to activate. When performing tasks, I'd like to be able, with one hand, to effortlessly depress the button. It feels like I have to apply more force than I like, and due to the smooth texture of the flashlight, it slides in the hand a bit. A more sensitive action in the button would be best. It's plenty bright though.
customer_reviews.author: The Rustbelt Sailor

customer_reviews.title: Great quality. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend carried this every day since I bought this for him and he's only needed to replace battery once with hundreds of uses. It is suprisingly bright for something so small. There is slight wear on the black coating but nothing major. (It is worn every day in his pocket). The clip occasionally pops off but is easily popped back on. Buying on Amazon was a more convenient way to buy and was a better value than Sportsman's which is where my boyfriend spotted this the first time.
customer_reviews.author: Smashmellow

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: I bought this flashlight to replace a Streamlight 88030 that died on me. The Streamlight 88030 ate through expensive batteries and wasn't good for everyday use because of this. This new flashlight is great and since it takes 2 AAAs it lasts A LOT longer and the batteries are cheaper. The light is not as bright because of this, but I prefer this pen light to the 88030 for my use.
customer_reviews.author: Storm E. Conaway

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, small, and light weight. Excellent output and small enough for tight spaces like in electronics and electrical cabinets. As for durability, it has survived plumbing primer and glue and drops from an 8' ladder onto concrete. Latest "test", I forgot it in my pants pocket and it went through the wash AND the dryer. Clicked it on and it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for what it is, but could be better as more.
customer_reviews.text: If you only need a floodlight in a tight spot this is great. I would love it to have a flashlight on the end. Since i use a flashlight quite often I would have to carry both and with all my other tools space is limited. I will be looking for another with flood and flash because this IS useful as a tight space flood but without the flash I've got no room for it.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Pen light
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this as a pen light (to check my patients pupils with at the hospital I work at). When I received the item and turned it on, I realized that this is a flash light that is about the size of a pen. Definitely TOO bright to flash it in my patients eyes! So I gave it to my husband, who is in the military. The light is made well and small enough to keep in your pocket. My husband loves it and uses it for many different things. Overall very happy with this pen light and will be purchasing it again when we need to!
customer_reviews.author: R.C.

customer_reviews.title: Great flashlight, weak clip
customer_reviews.text: Despite the diminutive size, this flashlight is quite bright (65 lumens) thanks to the C4 LED. Battery runtime of 6.5 hours on 2 AAA batteries is quite impressive. Also despite its low price tag, it has a quality feel and build to it which defines Streamlight products. The reason for the negative star is the weak clip. It's simple folded metal, not spring laded, so it is quite weak. If you don't care about the clip, say because you are going to keep it in the included pouch on your belt or in your pocket, then it's a 5 star product. Update: Dropped rating to 2 stars as I lost the flashlight due to the weak clip.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Streamlight pen light
customer_reviews.text: This is a bright easy to carry light. I recommend this for anyone who needs a light. Yiu can carry it in you shirt pocket,, always handy. I have 2 of these lights. Being a firefighter,this little light is very useful and handy. This is 100 lumens, so it’s pretty bright for a small light and great to have for when the power goes out. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: marty

customer_reviews.title: on/off switch is way too high effort
customer_reviews.text: I bought this if feb 2017, I am finally replacing it after three years of struggling to turn it on. The spring tension under the end switch is so strong and the barrel so smooth that you cannot operate it with one hand. I bought this for my wife but she swapped it for my Terralux which operates with ease. I am buying the hatori brand and will let you know. r. Kahn
customer_reviews.author: Richard C. Kahn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the pocket
customer_reviews.text: This a good EDC light for when I don't think I'll really need a light. It's plenty bright to see something that's rolled under your desk or find your way around if the lights go out. The one issue that I've had so far is the tail cap has to be in exactly the right position in order for the light to function. 5° either too loose or too tight and it will not come on. I don't know if only mine is affected or if others have had the same issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Payne

customer_reviews.title: Great little slim, unobtrusive, bright EDC flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: Light weight, slim, this little flashlight puts out a bright beam for EDC purposes without being obtrusive. Carries anywhere a pen would and weighs only a little more. Features a press and hold function for quick use as well as a press-click on/off function for longer use periods. Tuck it in a pocket and forget it until it’s needed. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: The Steppenwolf

customer_reviews.title: Awesome light!!!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great light for use inside equipment cabinets and while working on the car. I’ve had lights similar to this steamlight, but none compare to this one. The light given off is bright, but still soft so it’s not blinding. On high it’s bright enough to light up a room. The magnet is super powerful, you don’t need to worry about the light not staying where you want it. I also like the fact the battery is replaceable means I don’t have to toss the light in the trash.
customer_reviews.author: D. Green

customer_reviews.title: Holds up great even in a manufacturing environment
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered a few batches of these for my machinists and assemblers at work. They work with large fire protection valves with up to 8-10" inlets/outlets, meaning they're huge, hollow pieces of metal. Gets hard to see to assemble and assess quality inside them, so they all have these on their belts and shirt pockets. They love them and every new person always asks about getting one like everyone else's. I've gotten a lot of use out of mine; been on my belt for two years now. Terrific little flashlight. Bright, compact, convenient, lightweight: it checks every box. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Tanner S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Light, Nice Price
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this light accidentally but after checking it out I decided to keep it. I am a home inspector and when inspecting in close quarters, a small and bright light is a must. This fit the bill quite nicely. Compact but bright and the batteries last pretty well. I purchased a rechargeable light at the same time which was only a slight brighter. Good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Skip

customer_reviews.title: WHY, WHY WHY ?...WHY,  STREAMLIGHT ?
customer_reviews.text: Why is this pocket flashlight so awesome, long battery life, good brightness, nice design, YET.. the LENS TURNS YELLOW AND CRACKS AFTER 3 MONTHS OF DAILY USE. EVERY TIME ! Also the rubber on/off button sucks. I rip the rubber part off every time. PLEASE REFINE YOUR PRODUCT JUST A BIT MORE STREAMLIGHT PEOPLE, I'M TIRED OF WAITING FOR THE LENS TO FADE AND PLUNK DOWN $20 EVERY 3 MONTHS. I'm a mechanic btw. Sorry for shouting. Rant/off.
customer_reviews.author: Motorbreath

customer_reviews.title: Works well for Diesel Mechanic
customer_reviews.text: I got this light for my dad who works as a Diesel Mechanic. He loves it and often tells me how bright it is for such a small light. It takes two AA batteries. He keeps it in his shirt pocket along with a pocket screwdriver. I had a warranty issue with another light I had and Streamlight gave me a new light. They really do stand behind their product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Ingalls

customer_reviews.title: Belt holster loop doesn't fit the kind of belt worn by people who would keep a flashlight on them.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Streamlight. Love them. Been using daily for years. Unfortunately they seem to get lost rather easily. Only complaint is the belt loop on the included holster is made for thin belts like you wear with slacks, not a man's thick wide belt like you would wear if you carry things on your belt like a gun holster or flashlight. They need to realize they are selling most of these to working people not people who wear a flashlight to church.
customer_reviews.author: JamesNMandy

customer_reviews.title: Very nice pocket flashlight.
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace my Coast G20 flashlight that just stopped working one day, after little over a year of use. This is more durable and should last longer as I don't abuse my flashlights. Only issue is the button is a bit hard to press but got use to it after a couple uses. It's bright like my Coast one and is doing just as good a job.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Great light
customer_reviews.text: I'm a mechanic. I went 15 years without buying one of these because I thought they were kind of useless until my Snap-On guy gave me one for free. I don't know how I lived without one. Battery life is really good, it's bright and can get dropped in coolant and on concrete no problem lol. I lost that one and immediately bought this one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid, bright, but defective in design
customer_reviews.text: This is a nicely compact light which provides very bright illumination, ideal for dealing with cables behind the stereo cabinet or doing close work. Solid construction. Unfortunately, it is deficient in design. The push button in the end is very difficult to press to turn the light on. The designers apparently never had older people try their design before committing to manufacturing, where they would immediately have gotten feedback on this. The button would be all but impossible for those with arthritis or otherwise have impaired hands. Even for people with good hands, this button is very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: RBS

customer_reviews.title: Top of the line
customer_reviews.text: I had Streamlight flashlight (2AA)for more than 10 years excellent, lifetime warranty, the best thing is C4 LED, this time I want to try this new one with (2AAA) I am a very impressed, lightweight I use flashlight every day on my job as Technician. I see someone gave a negative review probably they don't know what they talking about and there is no way you can make everyone happy if I see 80% five stars that means it's very good, just ignore the negative people.
customer_reviews.author: sanjay

customer_reviews.title: Indispensable
customer_reviews.text: This durable everyday carrry penlight is lightly larger in length and diameter than a pen. The attached pocket clip allows it to be carried in a convenient pocket or pouch within easy reach. The two AAA batteries are easily obtained and the light is strong and bright. I like the end cap push to use button that is spring loaded to “OFF”. This penlight goes everywhere with me day in and day out. It’s as useful and indispensable as the small multi-purpose pocket tool I carry. Both are used numerous times over the course of a day. Very satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Vee2Speed

customer_reviews.title: Nice light
customer_reviews.text: I got one as a gift several at least 5-6 years ago. It worked great. Batteries lasted a long time. Bright but not too bright to use around the house. A month or so ago I tried to replace the batteries and it was stuck shut. I couldn't open it even with pliars. That happened before but not this bad. So I just tossed it in the garbage and bought a new one. 6 years of service is good enough.
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur

customer_reviews.title: best tech flashlight
customer_reviews.text: i dont know what happened to the mini maglites but was having problems with them consistently so im glad to have found this one. works all time and is small. its about 100 lumens i think....whatever it is its perfect brightness ....brighter is not always better....as a technician, if its too bright i cant see what im reading or doing!
customer_reviews.author: wjc1200

customer_reviews.title: Handy and Powerful
customer_reviews.text: These are great lights. I keep one on my nightstand, one in the truck, and one in the boat. They are super bright and for hands-free use you can hold it in your mouth. I use mine frequently, because for some reason I often find myself at boat ramps an hour before dawn. I need to work on that. I know there are lots of great lights on the market including other Streamlight models, and I haven't tried most of them, but this light does everything I need a light to do, at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen H. Parker

customer_reviews.title: and absolutely love it. I find myself using it
customer_reviews.text: Been carrying one for a while now, and absolutely love it. I find myself using it, honestly, probably every day. The finish is naturally "battle wearing" and that doesn't bother me one bit. Finishes on anything WILL wear if they're actually used. I would buy again and again, but I haven't managed to break mine yet. Maybe I'll buy more anyways just to support a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Expensive Small Flashlight - not a pointer
customer_reviews.text: I am very frustrated and disappointed in this purchase. It was $20 and it is not a pointer as described. I wanted something to play with my cat, but this is just a flashlight. The lighted head of the flashlight is a little less than 1/2". The light spreads out as it shines instead of a small stream of light for pointing. Also, in order to make it work, the button on the end of the flashlight must be pressed continuously. I want to return it but in order to get the flashlight out of the package, the package had to be torn open.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia S.

customer_reviews.title: Best pen light I've ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I use this light everyday at work. I've dropped it, kicked it, smashed it, bashed it and it still keep going. The batteries seem to last forever so i just replace them every two months to ensure i have the brightest light possible when working at night. It is a bright little thing... For the price, this light is amazing. I wouldn't hesitate to order a box of them and hand them out as gifts around the plant. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Devin J. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Best small flashlight
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a flashlight connisseur and he carries this one with him all the time. I work in a restaurant and need to make sure tables are clean underneath in the dark so he got this for me to carry in my apron and it's perfect. My boss bought one after he saw mine and we've given them as gifts. This is the absolute best, pen-sized light.
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Strong durable and lasts for a long time
customer_reviews.text: Love the lights for well over 8 years and they are durable and quite handy. I carry mine on my key chain with a D ring just because I tend to forget to bring a light. Also if you can use the front end as a self defense weapon in a pinch because that aluminum body hurts like a bitch if you get jabed by one.
customer_reviews.author: BakedPotato

customer_reviews.title: I made this purchase on the recommendation of a friend
customer_reviews.text: This is one mighty powerful flashlight for its size and battery. I actually bought 2 and have them both hidden from my hubs as he always likes to pilfer what I buy for myself. And he did, so I'm glad I bought a backup. I shouldn't have bought blue and black. Anyway, this has a low, and high beam and flash. My friend had his for years and its incredibly bright. It comes with a wrist strap and belt attachment. I'm on my way to buying feminine colors so I can find mine once he does. Lol.
customer_reviews.author: PansyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Hard to push on/off
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews before I bought so I was forewarned that the button on the end to turn on/off is hard to push. I'd hoped it would not be the case on the product I got, but it's true. It's really an effort to get it to click. I plan to keep it, but will keep shopping for a similar product that works easier for me.
customer_reviews.author: Darlene N

customer_reviews.title: Works great, highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic light for professional mechanics and diy'ers, and also excellent for scorpion hunting! I use them in a shop primarily but decided to take them camping when my friends and I went, oh boy are there a lot of scorpions in Nevada! In summary if you're looking for a great light for the shop or for camping, look no further. Also I cannot remember the last time I charged it but oh boy the battery life is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: DREWSASTER

customer_reviews.title: Best pen light out of many. SUPER BRIGHT
customer_reviews.text: I have had multiple pen lights and this is by far the brightest light I have seen. It looks very heavy duty and the button is on the harder side to push which I like because it won’t get turned on a random times like other brands I have had. The belt clip fits tight when in your pocket so no need to worry about it coming out of your pocket. Only complaint is the holster that comes with it goes through your belt at the top of if so it hangs too low on my side for my liking. Other than that it is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Best flashlight in its class
customer_reviews.text: I have had several of these flashlights for several years and they work great. I only use Streamlight products and being in Law Enforcement, I need something to work the first time everytime and have had no trouble with Streamlights. This fits well in any pocket or pen pocket. Perfect amount of light for smaller things. Not going to light up your whole yard but youll get to where youre going with it. Great buy
customer_reviews.author: zbwoodwork

customer_reviews.title: Fortunately, all I had to do is email Streamlight ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this light 2 years ago and i have completely mistreated it. I have dropped it from 15feet onto concrete, used it as a hammer, and run constantly up to 8 hours using high density batteries. Only recently has the button started engaging intermittently, had to wiggle to button around to get it to work. Fortunately, all I had to do is email Streamlight customer service asking how I could obtain a new button. The simply asked for my current address and the flashlight I wanted the button for. I didn't pay anything at all and it arrived in the mail in 3 days.
customer_reviews.author: Aron and Brianna

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for EDC as a daily use light
customer_reviews.text: You can't lose... These things rock! I've have purchased multiple Streamlight products over the years and they have never let me down. I still have all of them to this day. Mines either in a jean pocket or clipped to a backpack strap and being in the engineering service industry this thing has seen some use and abuse. I've dropped it more times than I'd like to admit and the finish is holding up well. Pros - durable - good battery life - sturdy belt clip (not super tight but perfect for in and out of the pocket) - great light Cons - On/off button takes some getting used to (it really requires a deliberate press to cycle it)
customer_reviews.author: Tim Poirier

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and great value.
customer_reviews.text: This little light is extremely bright and well worth the money. I got this for my wife for her nursing job but she said it was too bright for her patients eyes. The only downside if there could be one is the switch is momentary and not continuous but that is not a game changer at all. I would buy this again if hers died tomorrow and know I was getting a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Clade

product_meta.title: Streamlight 66149 Stylus Pro USB UV Rechargeable Pen Light with USB Cord and Nylon Holster
product_meta.description: Color:Black w/Ultraviolet LED| Size:USB Rechargable, No AC Adapter| Style:PenlightStreamlight 66149 Stylus Pro USB UV Rechargeable Pen Light with USB Cord and Nylon Holster
feature_bullets: Unbreakable and scratch resistant polycarbonate lens
Corrosion and water resistant, machined aircraft-grade aluminum alloy, Type II MIL-Spec anodize plating
Up to 6.5 hours of regulated runtime

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars10,176 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
